org.jcvi.jillion.sam.cigar

Enum CigarOperation

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<CigarOperation>
      • org.jcvi.jillion.sam.cigar.CigarOperation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Comparable<CigarOperation>

    public enum CigarOperation
extends Enum<CigarOperation>
    CigarOperation is an enumeration of all the different kinds of trimming and alignment operations that can be expressed in a CIGAR string.
    Author:
    dkatzel

    • Enum Constant Summary

      Enum Constants 
      Enum Constant and Description
      ALIGNMENT_MATCH
      Alignment match (can be a sequence match or mismatch).
      DELETION
      Insertion from the reference.
      HARD_CLIP
      Clipped sequences NOT present in the sequence.
      INSERTION
      Insertion to the reference.
      PADDING
      Silent deletion from padded reference.
      SEQUENCE_MATCH
      Sequence match.
      SEQUENCE_MISMATCH
      Sequence mismatch.
      SKIPPED
      Skipped region from the reference.
      SOFT_CLIP
      Clipped sequences present in the sequence.

    • Enum Constant Detail

      • ALIGNMENT_MATCH

        public static final CigarOperation ALIGNMENT_MATCH
        Alignment match (can be a sequence match or mismatch).

      • INSERTION

        public static final CigarOperation INSERTION
        Insertion to the reference. This causes the reference to insert a gap.

        For example: this read has an insertion of 2 bp with respect to the reference: 

         ref            TTAGTAA**GATA
 read           TTAGTAAAGGATA

      • DELETION

        public static final CigarOperation DELETION
        Insertion from the reference. This causes the READ to insert a gap.

        For example: this read has an deletion of 1 bp with respect to the reference: 

         ref            GATAGCTG
 read           GATA*CTG

      • SKIPPED

        public static final CigarOperation SKIPPED
        Skipped region from the reference. For mRNA-to-genome alignments, this is an intron; for all other types of alignments, this operation is undefined.

      • SOFT_CLIP

        public static final CigarOperation SOFT_CLIP
        Clipped sequences present in the sequence.

      • HARD_CLIP

        public static final CigarOperation HARD_CLIP
        Clipped sequences NOT present in the sequence.

      • PADDING

        public static final CigarOperation PADDING
        Silent deletion from padded reference. This is caused when the read AND the reference both have a deletion. This is caused by another read giving the reference an insertion:

        For example: this read2 has an padd 1 bp at position 8: 

         ref            TTAGTAA**GATA
 
 read1          TTAGTAAAGGATA
 read2          TTAGTAA*GGATA

      • SEQUENCE_MATCH

        public static final CigarOperation SEQUENCE_MATCH
        Sequence match.

      • SEQUENCE_MISMATCH

        public static final CigarOperation SEQUENCE_MISMATCH
        Sequence mismatch.

      • values

        public static CigarOperation[] values()
        Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: 
        for (CigarOperation c : CigarOperation.values())
    System.out.println(c);
        Returns:
        an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

      • valueOf

        public static CigarOperation valueOf(String name)
        Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.)
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the enum constant to be returned.
        Returns:
        the enum constant with the specified name
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name
        NullPointerException - if the argument is null

      • getOpCode

        public char getOpCode()
        Get this opCode for this operation that is used in SAM files.
        Returns:
        an opCode as a single character.

      • getBinaryOpCode

        public int getBinaryOpCode()
        Get this opCode for this operation that is used in BAM files.
        Returns:
        an opCode as an int.

      • parseBinary

        public static CigarOperation parseBinary(int bit)
        Parse the binary op code from a BAM encoded file into the CigarOperation.
        Parameters:
        bit - the binary opcode;
        Returns:
        the CigarOperation
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the opcode is invalid.

      • parseOp

        public static CigarOperation parseOp(String op)
        Parse the first character of the given String into a CigarOperation. This is the same as parseOp(op.charAt(0));
        Parameters:
        op - the opcode to parse.
        Returns:
        the CigarOperation; will never return null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the character is an invalid opcode.
        NullPointerException - if op is null.

      • parseOp

        public static CigarOperation parseOp(char op)
        Parse the given character into a CigarOperation.
        Parameters:
        op - the opcode to parse.
        Returns:
        the CigarOperation; will never return null.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the character is an invalid opcode.
